plugins.name: Logify
plugins.description:
Logify — Version Tracking for Design Systems


Keep your design system consistent — and versioned. This plugin helps you track changes to local styles and components in your Figma file, presenting differences in a clean, structured changelog directly on the canvas.


No need to log edits manually — Logify detects added, modified, and removed elements automatically.


What you can do:

  1. Compare current and previous file states
  2. Generate visual changelogs inside your file
  3. Group updates by Added / Changed / Removed
  4. Document design system evolution clearly

accepted.name: Pavel Grachev
accepted.description: Product designer with 5+ years of experience in web and mobile UI. Focused on clarity, usability, and quality design systems.

plugins.tagline: Effortless changelog for your design system

plugins.name: Background Color Generator
plugins.description:
Summary:

This plugin is ideal for B2B products where you want to integrate a client’s branding color into background designs while maintaining accessibility and strong visual contrast.


How to use:

Pick a color using the hue slider or a HEX code. Select the layer you want to apply the color to, then simply click the button to apply it. The plugin generates light and dark variations with the same hue.


Accessibility Compliance:

This plugin follows the WCAG 2.1 guidelines for color contrast:

  1. The light color is optimized for contrast against 87% black (#161616), and the dark color against white (#FFFFFF).
  2. For normal text (below 18pt bold / 24pt regular), the minimum contrast ratio is 4.5:1.
  3. For large text (18pt bold or 24pt regular and above), the minimum contrast ratio is 3:1.
  4. The generated light and dark color combinations exceed these minimum requirements, ensuring better readability and accessibility for users with visual impairments.


(Note: I made this plugin from Ai integrated in VS code. If you want to know more about what I do at work, you can check Daidai )
plugins.tagline: Color generator for light and dark backgrounds.

131068.name: Background Color Generator
131068.description:

Accessibility Compliance:

  1. The light color is optimized for contrast against 87% black (#161616), and the dark color against white (#FFFFFF).
  2. For normal text (below 18pt bold / 24pt regular), the minimum contrast ratio is 4.5:1.
  3. For large text (18pt bold or 24pt regular and above), the minimum contrast ratio is 3:1.
  4. The generated light and dark color combinations exceed these minimum requirements, ensuring better readability and accessibility for users with visual impairments.


(Note: I made this plugin from Ai integrated in VS code. If you want to know more about what I do at work, you can check Daidai )
131068.release_notes: Updated the layout only for a more reasonable layout
131068.tagline: Color generator for light and dark backgrounds.

plugins.name: Sloth D2C 设计稿转代码
plugins.description:
Sloth D2C 设计稿转代码插件是一款面向前端开发和设计团队的智能化工具，支持将设计稿快速转化为可直接用于生产的HTML代码。也支持输入文本&图片等信息通过AI一键生成设计稿。

1、高质量还原：通过该插件对设计稿生成的代码，在样式布局上能够高度还原设计稿，减少了人工编码的工时，省去设计走查流程。

2、更贴近人工代码：生成的代码支持tailwindcss、autolayout/flex布局、合理的行列分组，循环节点提取，图床托管等功能。

3、人工编辑：生成的代码不够满意，支持在线人工二次编辑，如图片节点的重新编解组、源码修改、属性调整等。

4、 一键生成设计稿：根据输入文本&图片等信息，结合prompt工程，AI生成指定风格页面代码后，再进一步转换成figma节点。
plugins.tagline: D2C-设计稿转码，A2D（AI生稿）

132784.name: Sloth D2C 设计稿转代码
132784.description:
Sloth D2C 设计稿转代码插件是一款面向前端开发和设计团队的智能化工具，支持将设计稿快速转化为可直接用于生产的HTML代码。也支持输入文本&图片等信息通过AI一键生成设计稿。

1、高质量还原：通过该插件对设计稿生成的代码，在样式布局上能够高度还原设计稿，减少了人工编码的工时，省去设计走查流程。

2、更贴近人工代码：生成的代码支持tailwindcss、autolayout/flex布局、合理的行列分组，循环节点提取，图床托管等功能。

3、人工编辑：生成的代码不够满意，支持在线人工二次编辑，如图片节点的重新编解组、源码修改、属性调整等。

4、 一键生成设计稿：根据输入文本&图片等信息，结合prompt工程，AI生成指定风格页面代码后，再进一步转换成figma节点。

plugins.name: Naming Helper
plugins.description:
# Naming Helper - 피그마 플러그인


선택된 프레임(들) 내의 모든 요소 이름을 한 번에 변경할 수 있는 피그마 플러그인입니다.


## 기능


- 선택된 프레임 내의 모든 하위 요소 이름을 일괄 변경

- 여러 프레임을 동시에 선택하여 일괄 처리 가능

- 현재 선택된 프레임 개수 표시

- 프레임이 선택되지 않았을 경우 알림 제공


## 사용 방법


1. 이름을 변경하고자 하는 프레임(들)을 선택합니다.

2. 플러그인을 실행합니다.

3. 입력 필드에 새로운 이름을 입력합니다.

4. "이름 변경하기" 버튼을 클릭합니다.

5. 프레임 내의 모든 요소 이름이 변경됩니다.
plugins.tagline: Naming Helper

125422.name: Naming Helper
125422.description:

plugins.name: Publish Ninja - Publish websites directly from Figma
plugins.description:
Turn your designs into live websites directly from Figma!

With Publish Ninja, you can instantly turn your Figma designs into fully functional, responsive websites directly from Figma.


🎉 Try it free! - We offer a 7-day free trial so you can experience publishing directly from Figma.


Why use Publish Ninja?

You’ve designed a website in Figma, but now you’re stuck. Either you need a developer, or you have to wrestle with complicated website builders. It’s frustrating, time-consuming, and slows you down.


Publish Ninja lets you publish fully responsive websites directly from Figma—no coding needed. With just a few clicks, your design goes live as a website.


⚡ How it Works

  1. Design in Figma – Create your site just like any other Figma project.
  2. Customize responsiveness – Easily adjust layouts for mobile, tablet, and desktop.
  3. Publish instantly – One click, and your website is live!


🔥 Why Choose Publish Ninja?


✅ No-Code website builder – No technical skills required.

✅ Live in seconds – Skip the hassle of exporting and coding.

✅ Custom domains – Publish on your own domain with ease.

✅ SEO-optimized – Built-in performance & search engine best practices.

Seamlessly publish directly to the web-no coding needed.

plugins.name: Codex — Repository-Aware Code Generator powered by AI
plugins.description:
Codex is an AI powered code generator that learns your existing repo. You can import your repository, and Codex will generate code in your used framework, using your styles and configurations. It works with any framework or language. No setup necessary — just import with one click and go!


Features


Code just like you wrote it yourself

Codex will adapt its code generation to the conventions and code style used across your repo. It will read config files and use the same libraries and frameworks you use in your project.


Refine your export further

Need to use a specific component? Instruct Codex to change your code and get a refined result, without losing the context. You can also do this multiple times, until you’re 100% happy.


Learns your repository with a one-click-import

You don’t have to map your figma components to your design system. Codex automatically recognizes which components you have implemented or installed and will use those for generating code.


Generates code in any framework or language

Any language, library or framework you are using in your repo will be used by Codex to generate code from Figma.


Learns from your feedback

As you refine your exports, Codex will remember your feedback and apply it to future code generations.


FAQ


Who is it for?

Codex is targeted at professional front end developers to speed up their workflows.


Does my figma file need special preparation?

No, but it works much better if all frames use auto layout.


Which frameworks are supported?

Codex is framework-agnostic. This means it can generate code in any language, for any framework. However, popular frameworks like React and Vue work best, as LLMs have more training data on them.


Can I use it without a repository?

Currently, no. But you can create a repository and initialize it with an empty skeleton in the framework of your choice, then Codex will generate code for that framework.


Does it work with monorepos?

If there is only one frontend package in the repo, likely yes. Better monorepo support is on the roadmap.


Does it only work in dev mode/design mode?

Codex works in both figma modes.


Does it only work with Github?

Currently, yes. Other providers coming soon.


Pricing


Check our pricing page for information on plans.
plugins.tagline: The code generator that understands your repository

plugins.name: SupaFastPages
plugins.description:
This plugin helps designers and teams using Figma to automatically convert sections in a design into separate pages. This can be especially useful when you want to organise your Figma document by moving grouped content (like artboards or frames in a section) into new individual pages.


Key Features:

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.

109166.name: SupaFastPages
109166.description:
This plugin helps designers and teams using Figma to automatically convert sections in a design into separate pages. This can be especially useful when you want to organise your Figma document by moving grouped content (like artboards or frames in a section) into new individual pages.


Key Features:

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
109166.release_notes:
1. UI Adjustments and Styling

•Dialog Box Sizing: Set the dimensions explicitly using figma.showUI(__html__, { width: 260, height: 320 }) in code.ts to ensure the interface displays without scrolling.
•Glassmorphic Background: Updated the container background to use a semi-transparent style with blur and shadow effects, enhancing the visual appeal.
•Font Updates: Applied SF Pro font styling to various elements to maintain a consistent and professional look.

2. Button Behavior Enhancement

•Dynamic Button Text: The Convert button initially displays “Select an Option” and is disabled. When the user selects either “Sections” or “Frames,” the text changes to “Convert,” and the button becomes enabled.
•Button Style Changes: Updated the styling of the disabled and enabled states of the button to use appropriate gradients and colors, making the active state more visually distinct.

3. Selection Feedback

•Option Selection Toggle: Added visual feedback for option selection. When “Sections” or “Frames” is selected, it highlights in red while the unselected option remains grey.
•Single Selection at a Time: Ensured that only one option can be selected at a time, with the other being deselected.

4. User Guidance

•Clear Instruction via Button: By changing the button text dynamically based on the selection, the update guides users through the necessary steps (selecting an option) before conversion, improving usability.
109166.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.

plugins.name: Twenty3 Template Tagging
plugins.description:
Export graphics for the Twenty3 Toolbox.


How to use:

  1. Start by installing the Twenty3 Template Tagging plugin from the Resources tab in Figma
  2. Select the Frame or Layer that you would like to export
  3. Check the preview in the plugin interface
  4. Click the export button in the plugin header to save the formatted SVG locally
  5. Upload the SVG at https://toolbox.twenty3.sport/graphic-editor using your Toolbox credentials


Technical details:

  1. SVG text elements are replaced with foreignObject elements so that text can be populated dynamically and manually in the Toolbox editor
  2. Figma's image rect elements are replaced with and image tag containing base64 encoded data


Notes:

  1. Font binding takes place in the Toolbox, so if you do not have the fonts downloaded to your device you will not see them in the preview
plugins.tagline: Software to format and export templates for the Twenty3 Toolbox

131409.name: Twenty3 Template Tagging
131409.description:

  3. Check the preview in the plugin interface
  4. Click the export button in the plugin header to save the formatted SVG locally
  5. Upload the SVG at https://toolbox.twenty3.sport/graphic-editor using your Toolbox credentials


Technical details:

  1. SVG text elements are replaced with foreignObject elements so that text can be populated dynamically and manually in the Toolbox editor
  2. Figma's image rect elements are replaced with and image tag containing base64 encoded data


Notes:

  1. Font binding takes place in the Toolbox, so if you do not have the fonts downloaded to your device you will not see them in the preview

131409.tagline: Software to format and export templates for the Twenty3 Toolbox

plugins.name: Figma to BlocksIn System
plugins.description:
The BlocksIn System plugin for Figma is a game-changer for front-end development. Effortlessly convert Figma designs into React components, ready for implementation with our NPM package.


BlocksIn System - React Component Library


Here's how it simplifies your workflow:


  • Design: Create patterns using Figma components.
  • Generate: Select a frame and click 'Generate' to convert it into React markup.
  • Implement: Seamlessly integrate the code with BlocksIn System React components.
  • Reuse: Streamline your process by reusing design patterns.


Watch the video here.


Special thanks to my friend Eugenio who inspired this project. Check out his amazing work.


Get started with the BlocksIn System plugin and revolutionise your design-to-development process!
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma designs into React BlocksIn System components effortlessly.

plugins.name: Top'n'Fix
plugins.description:
Tired of constantly switching to the prototype panel to fix a layer or frame? With the Top'n'Fix plugin, you can easily bind it to the shortcut combination of shift+opt+cmd+] and accomplish it with a single click, saving you time and effort.

Key Features:

  1. Streamlined Fixing: Instantly fix any layer or frame without the need to navigate to the prototype panel.
  2. Efficient Shortcut: Assign the shift+opt+cmd+] shortcut to quickly apply fixes with a single keystroke.


Please note that at least one object should already be fixed on the screen, fixed area in layers must be created. Hope to fix it in next version.
plugins.tagline: Fix layer, bring to the front and fix, fix frame, fix in the prototype

plugins.name: Fill Cleaner
plugins.description:
Fill Cleaner helps you maintain clean, efficient Figma files by removing redundant fills from layers. Whether it’s multiple image fills, solid colors, or gradients, the plugin preserves only the topmost fill of each type—no visual changes, just a lighter file.


✨ Smart Fill Cleaning

  1. Image fills: Keep the topmost image
  2. Color fills: Remove redundant solids
  3. Gradient fills: Retain just the top gradient
  4. CMD+K for quick commands
  5. Batch cleaning: Works on selections or entire pages


🖼️ Lummi.ai Integration

  1. Instantly apply images to selected layers
  2. Great for refreshing mockups and prototypes


🕒 When to Use

  1. Design cleanup: Tidy up before handoff
  2. File optimization: Reduce size, speed up performance
  3. After explorations: Clear leftover fills
  4. Before sharing: Ensure your files are clean
  5. With imports: Fix cluttered layers from other tools


Try Image Fill Cleaner and keep your designs sharp, efficient, and handoff-ready.
plugins.tagline: Remove extra image, color, and gradient fills. Works on selections or entire pages with ease.

plugins.name: Dummy datazer
plugins.description:
The Dummy datazer plugin enhances your Figma design workflow by allowing you to replace text in selected text layers with randomly generated data. With this plugin, you can effortlessly populate your designs with realistic placeholders, including:


- Full Names : Choose from a diverse list of 100 full names.

- Company Names : Select from 50 company names.

- Addresses : Utilize 50 unique addresses for location-based designs.

- Phone Numbers : Insert 50 different phone numbers for contact information.

Simply select the text layers you wish to update, choose the type of data you want to insert, and let the plugin do the rest. The Dummy datazer ensures your designs are filled with dynamic and varied content, perfect for mockups and testing scenarios.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly Populate Your Designs with Dynamic Data

plugins.name: Layer Sweeper
plugins.description:
Effortlessly organize and declutter your design files with the "Layer Sweeper" plugin.


This plugin scans your entire file to identify and delete hidden layers, frames, and groups while respecting locked layers and hidden layers within master components. Streamline your workflow, optimize file performance, and maintain a clean, professional design environment with ease. Perfect for keeping your Figma files organized and efficient.


If you have any suggestions or inquiries, feel free to reach out to me on Twitter.


If you appreciate my work, consider showing your support by buying me a coffee.
plugins.tagline: Remove hidden layers with a single click.

plugins.name: Variable Length Lorem Ipsum
plugins.description:
Most text generator plugins let you specify a single number for the word count. However, sometimes you want to specify a range instead, to introduce variability, and create more realistic results (realistic for lorem ipsum text, that is)


Features:

  1. Generates lorem ipsum text with the option of varied lengths.
  2. Enter a single number (e.g., "10") for fixed word count or a range (e.g., "5-10") for random variation within limits.
  3. Optionally add punctuation for generated text (default: off).
  4. Optionally auto-close the plugin after generating text (default: off).
  5. Supports your system setting for light or dark mode.
plugins.tagline: Specify a range of lengths for your lorem ipsum text

137731.name: Variable Length Lorem Ipsum
137731.description:

  2. Enter a single number (e.g., "10") for fixed word count or a range (e.g., "5-10") for random variation within limits.
  3. Optionally add punctuation for generated text (default: off).
  4. Optionally auto-close the plugin after generating text (default: off).
  5. Supports your system setting for light or dark mode.
137731.release_notes: Fixed an issue where selected text nodes would change their resizing method when the text changed.
137731.tagline: Specify a range of lengths for your lorem ipsum text

plugins.name: Frame Duplicator
plugins.description:
Frame Duplicator is a plugin designed to help designers and social media managers quickly create multiple posts based on CSV data and images. Perfect for batch processing posts for social media, marketing, or any other repetitive content creation tasks.


In a sentence: Choose images and upload a CSV file listing the images and any text you’d like displayed. This plugin will read your CSV, duplicate a selected frame, and insert the specified images as the background along with the provided text in designated areas.


Key Features:

CSV Integration: Automatically populate frames with text fields such as titles and subtitles based on CSV data, making it easy to maintain consistent content across multiple designs.

Image Replacement: Efficiently replace images in frames based on file names specified in the CSV, allowing you to work seamlessly with visual content.

Aspect Ratio Preservation: Ensures that images maintain their aspect ratio when resized within frames, avoiding distortion or stretching.

Batch Frame Duplication: Create multiple frames with the click of a button, with each frame populated by unique data and images from your CSV.


How to Use:

Prepare CSV and Images: Make sure your CSV file includes columns for text fields (title and subtitle) and image filenames.


Your CSV column titles must be:

title, subtitle, imageName.


Select a Frame in Figma: Choose the frame you want to duplicate.


Your Frame must include text / rectangle elements titled:

##Title ##Image ##Subtitle


Upload CSV and Images: Load your CSV and corresponding image files through the plugin’s interface.

Create Frames: Click "Create Frames" to generate frames based on the CSV data, with each frame containing unique text and images row by row.
plugins.tagline: Duplicate frames with text and images based on CSV data for streamlined post creation

108356.description:

plugins.name: MultiDesign Assistant
plugins.description:
MultiDesign Assistant 是一款多功能設計輔助工具，能提升 Figma 的工作效率。這個插件提供了四個實用功能：


一鍵交換填充和描邊顏色：快速切換物件的填充和描邊顏色，節省設計時間。

快速調整尺寸：輸入具體數值，一鍵調整物件的長度和寬度。

等比縮小：通過輸入自定義比例或選擇預設值，輕鬆實現物件的等比例縮小。

圓形文字標籤：為選中的文字自動添加圓形背景，完美適用於創建數字標籤等設計元素。



MultiDesign Assistant is a versatile design tool aimed at enhancing productivity for Figma users. This plugin offers four practical features:


One-click Fill and Stroke Swap: Quickly exchange the fill and stroke colors of objects, saving design time.


Quick Size Adjustment: Input specific values to instantly adjust the length and width of objects.


Proportional Scaling: Easily scale objects proportionally by entering custom ratios or selecting from preset values.


Circular Text Labels: Automatically add circular backgrounds to selected text, perfect for creating number tags and similar design elements.
plugins.tagline: Swap colors, adjust sizes, scale proportionally, add circular text backgrounds.

plugins.name: Unit Converter Pro - Measurement Calculator for Figma
plugins.description:
Unit Converter Pro - The Ultimate Measurement Calculator for Figma

Transform your design workflow with the most comprehensive unit conversion tool available for Figma. Unit Converter Pro instantly converts between any measurement units across 8 different categories, saving you valuable design time.

Features:

• Convert between ALL common design units: pixels, inches, cm, points, and more

• Support for 8 conversion categories: Length, Area, Volume, Weight, Temperature, Time, Speed, and Data

• Real-time conversion as you type - see results instantly

• Clean, intuitive interface that matches Figma's design language

• Works directly within your Figma workspace - no need to switch between apps

Perfect for:

• UI/UX designers working across different measurement systems

• Design teams collaborating internationally

• Creating responsive designs that require precise unit conversions

• Print and digital designers who need to convert between physical and digital units

• Anyone who wants to save time on manual calculations

Stop wasting time with manual calculations or switching between apps. Unit Converter Pro handles all your measurement conversion needs in one place, letting you focus on what matters most - your designs.

Convert any unit with just a few clicks and design with confidence!

plugins.name: Retro Color Converter
plugins.description:
Transform your Figma designs into nostalgic retro-style PNG images with flexible bit depth control. Perfect for pixel art, game assets, and vintage aesthetics.


Features:

- Color depth options: 6-bit, 9-bit, 12-bit

- Three dithering modes: Flat, Gradient, Full

- Floyd-Steinberg algorithm for smooth transitions

- Auto-positioning next to original objects

- One-click conversion

- Supports all layer types


Ideal for retro games, pixel art, and creative effects. Complete control over color quantization and dithering.
plugins.tagline: Convert designs to retro-style PNG images with customizable bit depth and dithering options

plugins.name: Flatten to Image
plugins.description:
This plugin flattens each selected layer into a single image. It can either replace the original layers or create a copy to the right. You can also select desired format, and resolution.

Works similar to "Copy as PNG" option, but you don't have to do it multiple times if you have a lot of layers, nor export them and import again.
plugins.tagline: Transform selected layers into flattened PNGs or JPGs in bulk.

126298.name: Flatten to Image
126298.description:
This plugin flattens each selected layer into a single image. It can either replace the original layers or create a copy to the right. You can also select desired format, and resolution.

Works similar to "Copy as PNG" option, but you don't have to do it multiple times if you have a lot of layers, nor export them and import again.
126298.tagline: Transform selected layers into flattened PNGs or JPGs in bulk.

plugins.name: Archiver
plugins.description:
Archiver is a streamlined utility that helps you declutter your Figma workspace without losing valuable design history. With a single click, it automatically moves selected elements to a dedicated Archive page, organizing them chronologically by date.


Unlike manual archiving, this plugin:

  1. Preserves all properties including auto layout, components, and text styling
  2. Intelligently arranges archived items by date for easy retrieval
  3. Handles any element type (frames, components, vectors, text, etc.)
  4. Works with batch selections for efficient cleanup
  5. Maintains a clear naming convention with date stamps


Perfect for design teams that need to keep their working files clean while maintaining access to previous iterations, explorations, or unused concepts. Simply select what you want to archive, run the plugin, and continue designing with a cleaner workspace.
plugins.tagline: Organize Design History: One-Click Element Archiving

128151.name: Archiver
128151.description:
Archiver is a streamlined utility that helps you declutter your Figma workspace without losing valuable design history. With a single click, it automatically moves selected elements to a dedicated Archive page, organizing them chronologically by date.


Unlike manual archiving, this plugin:

  1. Preserves all properties including auto layout, components, and text styling
  2. Intelligently arranges archived items by date for easy retrieval
  3. Handles any element type (frames, components, vectors, text, etc.)
  4. Works with batch selections for efficient cleanup
  5. Maintains a clear naming convention with date stamps


Perfect for design teams that need to keep their working files clean while maintaining access to previous iterations, explorations, or unused concepts. Simply select what you want to archive, run the plugin, and continue designing with a cleaner workspace.
128151.release_notes:
Key fixes:

Added await figma.loadAllPagesAsync() at the beginning to ensure all pages are loaded
Added await archivePage.loadAsync() when finding the Archive page
Added null checks before accessing archivePage.children
Made the code more defensive with additional checks throughout
128151.tagline: Organize Design History: One-Click Element Archiving

plugins.name: Design Review Notes
plugins.description:
Streamline your design review process with an easy-to-use annotation tool for Figma. Select any object or frame, add comments, and assign a review status to keep your team aligned. Statuses are:

  1. Review Needed
  2. Approved
  3. Changes Needed
  4. Not Ready


If you have suggested for additional statuses or new features, let me know.


This tool is perfect for both async teams or capturing meeting notes during design critiques, this plugin helps designers flag areas for review and allows reviewers to provide structured feedback with full traceability. Capture design decisions, document revisions, and ensure clear communication, whether for quick approvals or in-depth discussions.


✦ Mark design elements for review

✦ Assign statuses for clarity

✦ Capture feedback & decisions in context

✦ Improve async collaboration & meeting documentation


Keep your design process transparent and efficient. Try it now!
plugins.tagline: Select objects in your file to quickly annotate and add a review status.

135844.description: This app allows you to design all your VUSION label templates
135844.release_notes:
- Add price handling with ._price attribute 
- Convert barcode (group) to vector.

plugins.name: Center Everything
plugins.description: Have you ever wanted to center all the text and the frames within a layer all at once? Instead of clicking through each individual layer and frame and adjusting the text align and frame alignment properties individually just run the Center Everything plugin!
plugins.tagline: One click to center all text and autolayout frames

107540.name: Center Everything
107540.description: Have you ever wanted to center all the text and the frames within a layer all at once? Instead of clicking through each individual layer and frame and adjusting the text align and frame alignment properties individually just run the Center Everything plugin!
107540.tagline: One click to center all text and autolayout frames

plugins.name: Drum Pad Plugin

plugins.name: Code Generator
plugins.description: First, select a front-end image (only one can be selected at a time, select multiple images to use the first one by default), then obtain the api-key from the plug-in interface and fill in the input box, then click the generate button, and wait for the result to be generated.
plugins.tagline: Use the multimodal large model GLM-4V to convert the designed image into front-end code

102334.name: Code Generator
102334.description: First, select a front-end image (only one can be selected at a time, select multiple images to use the first one by default), then obtain the api-key from the plug-in interface and fill in the input box, then click the generate button, and wait for the result to be generated.
102334.tagline: Use the multimodal large model GLM-4V to convert the designed image into front-end code

plugins.name: Page Finder
plugins.description:
Search top-level frames and select it.


快速搜索并定位图层。


  • 输入框自动聚焦；
  • 定位时自动缩放图层；
  • 支持回车搜索。
plugins.tagline: Search top-level frames；快速搜索并定位图层

55842.release_notes: Auto focus; Zoom fit view; Input enter.
